word:
7 T.--257 
     At bountiful tables, men often eat much more than can be easily digested. The overburdened stomach can not do its work properly. The result is 

178 

a disagreeable feeling of dullness in the brain, and the mind does not act quickly. Disturbance is created by improper combinations of food; fermentation sets in; the blood is contaminated and the brain confused.
